page.title: 17BARNSLEY FARM.
page.content: This farm is held by{Mr Priddle,}a tenant farmer on the High Hall Estate. it has been in his family for 48 years. The farmer before this was a Mr. Churchill and a Mr. Hayter. The farm is{mainly dairy}with a herd of 103 Freisians in milk, 1 Hereford bull, 26 heifers in calf and 23 calves.There are also 43 Suffolk Cross ewes 3 rams and 20 lambs. The farm is 108 Hect. 1h.buildings, 21.64h. barley, 2.3h. kale, 82.92h. grazing. Buildings include 1 breast milking parlour(8 standing, 8 milking.), 1 Dutch barn, 1 brick barn, 1 covered yard and 1 machinery store.{Dairy {output is 1767 litres milk per annum. All barley is sold to Chilbridge farm for fodder.{Machinery includes}4 tractors, 1 forage harvester, 1 mower, 1 baler. Pop. 11 people, 3 workers. Some land on Pills and Hinton moors.
